Articles.Content:
Hi gang!

I was recently prototyping out a rover design, and needed to activate Hack Gravity to escape a potentially bad situation. It stayed on the next time I launched.

I restarted the game: same thing.

No buttons on the 'debug toolbar' seem to change anything.

How does turn off pls?

Yeah, I have absolutely no idea what 'hack gravity' is supposed to do. It seems to reduce the gravity of the planet by a huge percentage. The only fix I've been able to apply is going to the Space Centre and then coming back to the spacecraft.
What I know is restarting the game will turn off any debug settings.

I hacked gravity in order to help in getting a massive spaceship into space. I tried to click it again to turn it off after reaching orbital speeds, but it didn't work. I tried restarting the game multiple times, but now my craft is on a course towards the outside of the solar system.
What happens if you try to adjust the orbit? Does that work normally?

They're making the "Hack gravity" option toggleable in 0.21!

It gives itself for some dumb stuff, but it'll be very helpful too.
Currently, the only way is to move to another SOI or return to space center. Warning, anything floating in the air will be deleted when you go back to space center.
